summary: This document is a series of daily assignment rosters for the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York from August 8-10, 2019. It details staff shifts, posts, overtime, leave statuses (sick, annual), and changes to assignments. It is significant as it provides a detailed operational log of the correctional facility's staffing during the period when Jeffrey Epstein was incarcerated there, showing routine administrative functions. This document is a Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) staff roster and shift log for Saturday, August 10, 2019. It details officer assignments, posts, shift changes, and leave statuses (sick/annual) for the facility. The log shows numerous staff changes and overtime occurrences, providing a snapshot of jail operations around the time Jeffrey Epstein was incarcerated there.

Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) - inferred from document context (staff roster, posts like SHU, UNIT, LOBBY, CONTROL)
keyFacts: The document is a detailed internal staff assignment roster for the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York for August 8-10, 2019.
It shows routine administrative operations including shift assignments, post rotations, overtime (OT), compensatory time (CT), and various leave statuses (Sick Leave, Annual Leave, LWOP, AWOL).
Several correctional officers are named, including Thomas, M; Baptiste; Diaz; Matos, E; and Noel, T, with their duty statuses frequently changing.
The roster includes specialized posts such as SHU (Special Housing Unit), CONTROL, ESCORT, and VISIT, indicating the facility's operational structure.
The document provides no direct information about inmates, including Jeffrey Epstein; it is purely a record of staff logistics.
The document is a staff roster and shift log for the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) dated Saturday, August 10, 2019.
It records numerous staff status changes to 'Sick Leave' or 'Annual Leave', along with overtime assignments and post rotations.
The log shows a total of 116 Correctional Services Staff and 7 Non-Correctional Services Staff were scheduled, with 25 Overtime Occurrences.
Specific officers like Thomas, M and Noel, T are noted with multiple status changes, indicating potential staffing fluctuations.
The document provides operational context for the jail's staffing during the period when Jeffrey Epstein was an inmate.
